channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for FL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for FL

item.title: Report E-2023100521
item.description:
Report E-2023100521

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-20T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-06
  • City: OCALA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 6, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN2004 was damaged due to a loose lid and released approximately one (1) cup of product to the drum lid. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Alpha-Omega Training and Compliance (AOTC) to remediate the impacted site. The lid was wiped down with absorbent pads to remove any residual product. All impacted materials were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal purposes. The 30-gallon drum was collected and containerized into one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for disposal purposes.

item.title: Report E-2023100487
item.description:
Report E-2023100487

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-19T15:12:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-07
  • City: Miami
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: ATLAS AIR WORLDWIDE HOLDINGS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 7 October 2023 an aircraft engine (engine type CF6-80C2) was prepared as UN3528. The engine was loaded on the aircraft and during the cargo inspection it was discovered that the engine was leaking. The spill was contained to the aircraft engine stand/pallet. While the aircraft engine was on the aircraft the protective tarp was lifted to inspect the engine, and more leakage was discovered. The engine was removed from the aircraft.

item.title: Report X-2023091012
item.description:
Report X-2023091012

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-23T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-20
  • City: OCALA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found punctured and wet. Upon inspection it as found that 1 steel drum of ethyl acetate was punctured on the top of the drum causing leakage. DescribePack: 1 steel drum of ethyl acetate was punctured on the top of the drum causing leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in a hazmat lined tote.

item.title: Report E-2023100532
item.description:
Report E-2023100532

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-20T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-20
  • City: HIALEAH
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that 20 case of carbamate pesticide (un2991) had been damaged by other freight and that 5 of the inner poly 1 gallon bottles had released 5 gallons of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE FOUND WET/LEAKING. PLACED IN BAG FOR QA. DescribePack: INSPECTION FOUND LIQUID CONTENT HAD BEEN LEAKING FROM CAP ON BOTTLE, CAUSING DAMAGE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: BOTTLE PLACED UPRIGHT; PACKAGE REMOVED FROM AREA OF OTHER PACKAGES.

item.title: Report X-2023090996
item.description:

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet. Upon inspection found 1 glass bottle of Acetonitrile had loose lid which resulted leakage. Glass bottles were packed in cardboard that secure both top & bottom of bottles. DescribePack: Bottle had loose lid which resulted leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in hazmat bag lined tote.

item.description:
Report X-2023090973

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: METAL PAIL WAS DROPPED, CAUSING THE DRUM TO BECOME DENTED, PLACED IN TOTE FOR QA. DescribePack: INSPECTION FOUND THAT THE DENTING ON THE PAIL COMPROMISED THE BOTTOM WELDED SEAM, AND WAS ALLOWING LEAKAGE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PLACED IN TOTE, REMOVED FROM AREA OF OTHER PACKAGES.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: When the package was being unloaded from a trailer, it was discovered that it had been leaking. It was immediately placed in a double-lined hazmat bin and moved to a well-ventilated area. DescribePack: Loose caps DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: It was immediately placed in a double-lined hazmat bin and moved to a well-ventilated area.

item.title: Report X-2023081016
item.description:
Report X-2023081016

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-24T00:32:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-24
  • City: MIAMI
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 07/24/2023, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 5190395 at the station location in Miami, reporting a flammable liquid spill. The shipment consisted of 4 fiberboard boxes, each containing 4 metal cans. One of the cans leaked due loose closure, resulting in spillage. The entire shipment is being held and the affected pacakge has been placed in a salvage drum and await an amended shipper's declaration for further transport.
